discussion.content:
You can use the Content search eDiscovery tool in the Microsoft 365 compliance center to search for in-place content such as email, documents, and instant messaging conversations in your organization. Use this tool to search for content in these cloud-based Microsoft 365 data sources:


Exchange Online mailboxes

SharePoint Online sites and OneDrive for Business accounts

Microsoft Teams

Microsoft 365 Groups

Yammer Groups

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/content-search?view=o365-worldwide

Applications where Content Search can be used to find Customer Data:

Calendar
Excel
Office Lens
OneDrive for Business
OneNote
Outlook/Exchange
People
PowerPoint
SharePoint
Skype for Business
Tasks
Teams
To Do
Video
Visio
Word

Com o método Content Search eDiscovery, você pode pesquisar e descobrir informações em determinados aplicativos e serviços da Microsoft. Os aplicativos que podem ser pesquisados com este método incluem:

B. Microsoft Outlook
D. Microsoft SharePoint Online

Portanto, as opções B e D são as corretas. Você pode pesquisar informações nos e-mails do Microsoft Outlook e nos conteúdos armazenados no Microsoft SharePoint Online.

Selected Answer: BD
The answer is B and D.

Got BD
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/content-search?view=o365-worldwide

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.
You have been tasked with removing customer information in compliance with General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), after the customer generated data subject request (DSR). You want to make sure that legal holds are placed on relevant information if the opportunity arises.
You want to start searching for the client's information by using Content Search eDiscovery.
Which of the following applications can be searched with this method? (Choose two.)

You are the Microsoft 365 administrator for a company.
Which two admin roles can purchase more licenses? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
You must be either a Global or Billing admin to do the tasks

C and D
This was in the exam on 3rd April 23

Answer: C,D

Here is the link to the page that lists the different administrator roles and their privileges:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/add-users/about-admin-roles?view=o365-worldwide#comparing-roles

Under the "Billing administrator" role description, it specifically states that "Billing administrators can purchase licenses and view billing information." And under the "Global administrator" role description, it states that "Global administrators can manage all aspects of Microsoft 365 services, including managing user accounts, domains, licenses, and billing."
it is billing and global
Sorry correct C,D

"You must be either a Global or Billing admin to do the tasks described in this article. For more information, see About admin roles."

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/commerce/licenses/buy-licenses?view=o365-worldwide
C, D are corret

Correct.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/directory-assign-admin-roles

Note

Previously, this role was called "Service Administrator" in Azure portal and Microsoft 365 admin center. We have renamed it to "Service Support Administrator" to align with the exsiting name in Microsoft Graph API, Azure AD Graph API, and Azure AD PowerShell.

choices.B: from the Microsoft website using a corporate credit card
choices.D: with an Enterprise Agreement (EA) subscription from Microsoft

E3/F1/E5/E3

It says that desktop apps are required, so therefore E5
we have E3 and audio conf is included

Audio conferencing is not included in E3 according to this

As per this, it looks like audio conferencing is included in E5. https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/audio-conferencing

discussion.content:
While the answers are correct it would be helpful if the question stated that we must minimize the cost....
Theoretically, now, I could slap E5 licenses everywhere at it would still be correct.
Question still relevant? These days Teams need to be added as an addon with enterprise licenses. Only F3 license has Teams included (web version).

comments.content: This matrix shows the free Addon for E3. This question is older than march 22, wether Microsoft updated the answer is a risk we have to take

discussion.content:
That about the audio conferencing is hard to tell:

https://www.quexcel.com/knowledge-base/knowledge-base/no-longer-additional-cost-for-microsoft-teams-audio-conferencing/#:~:text=On%20this%20website%20you%20can%20read%20how%20implementing%20Audio%20Conferencing%20works.&text=Before%20you%20become%20too%20happy,365%20F1%2C%20F3%20and%20E3

Free of charge
Starting March 1st 2022 Microsoft will no longer charge customer for the audio conferencing option. This enables users to dial in to cloud-hosted conference calls with telephone numbers. To enable the audio conference option, customers should order 0 US$ SKU’s from their price list and assign them to the people who plan or lead Teams meetings. On this website you can read how implementing Audio Conferencing works.

E3 allows for calling within teams but 'conferencing calls' allow up to 100 members in a call. This is specifically available within E5 and NOT E3 
https://www.microsoft.com/en-gb/microsoft-teams/audio-conferencing?rtc=1

https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/microsoft-365/compare-microsoft-365-enterprise-plans?ef_id=_k_Cj0KCQjwpPKiBhDvARIsACn-gzAG480jT5YO535xY-B52rS7z3e36PQMvS1Mq531e_SyAeBl-Ic-10EaAhnYEALw_wcB_k_&OCID=AIDcmmwf9kwzdj_SEM__k_Cj0KCQjwpPKiBhDvARIsACn-gzAG480jT5YO535xY-B52rS7z3e36PQMvS1Mq531e_SyAeBl-Ic-10EaAhnYEALw_wcB_k_&gclid=Cj0KCQjwpPKiBhDvARIsACn-gzAG480jT5YO535xY-B52rS7z3e36PQMvS1Mq531e_SyAeBl-Ic-10EaAhnYEALw_wcB

E3 contains audio conferencing with MS Teams and supports desktop apps. Shouldn't the answer to acquisitions be E3? Or is it E5 because it doesn't explicitly state MS Teams? 

https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/microsoft-365/compare-microsoft-365-enterprise-plans
https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/microsoft-365/enterprise/e3?activetab=pivot%3aoverviewtab

For finance - 'automated investigation and response to threats' needs 'Microsoft Defender for Endpoint P2' which is covered with an E5 subscription (its not enough to have 'Endpoint P1' - this will not 'automate investigation and incident response' - Endpoint P1 is the one included with E3) 

"Microsoft Defender for Endpoint P2 offers the complete set of capabilities, including everything in P1 plus endpoint detection and response, automated investigation and incident response, and threat and vulnerability management."

https://www.microsoft.com/en-gb/security/business/threat-protection/endpoint-defender

comments.content: Nobody argues with this statement. Definitely E5. The answer tells the same.

discussion.content: E3 includes MS Teams yet it doesn't include a Phone System, Audio Conferencing.

https://www.microsoft.com/en-sg/microsoft-365/compare-microsoft-365-enterprise-plans:
"Formerly Microsoft 365 F1" (Under F3)

Answer is correct
So F3 is the same as F1? which one is the old name and which the new? Its confusing...

Acquisitions - will be E5 due to audio conferencing calls (Teams)

customer service - F3 will work, only need outlook and exchange

Finance - you will need the E5 for investigation and response threats

Purchasing - E3 will work, do not need audio conferencing (Teams)
